title: Oil prices ease as traders weigh Middle East tensions, demand
text: Oil prices inched lower on Tuesday as the International Energy Agency said it would act quickly if needed to keep the market supplied amid tensions in the Middle East and traders eyed a weaker demand outlook.

title: Huawei's U.S. research arm slashes jobs as trade ban bites
text: China's Huawei Technologies laid off more than two-thirds of the 850-strong workforce at its Futurewei Technologies research arm in the United States, after being blacklisted by the government.

title: Iran’s bitcoin interest should have the world concerned
text: The Associated Press reported last week that there is a boom in bitcoin use — in Iran. “Some observers have warned that cryptocurrencies could be used to bypass the Trump administration’s sanctions targeting Iran over its unraveling nuclear deal with world powers,” explained AP.

title: Commercial real estate may benefit from interest rate cuts and big tech
text: Marcus & Millichap CEO Hessam Nadji, and Yahoo Finance's Aikiko Fujita discuss why the commercial real estate market may benefit from a Fed rate cut and tech companies.

title: Markets are expecting Fed to cut rates but what comes after that?
text: Morgan Stanley Portfolio Manager Jim Caron, along with Yahoo Finance's Andy Serwer and Myles Udland discuss the upcoming FOMC meeting, the stock market and the global economy outlook.

title: Easing hopes prop up global stocks, pound sags as Britain eyes new PM
text: Expectations of policy easing by major central banks such as the Federal Reserve propped up global stocks on Tuesday, while the pound sagged as Britain braced for a new prime minister who could pave the way for a no-deal exit from the European Union.

title: Pullback underway and investors should buy it: Market bull Tony Dwyer
text: Canaccord Genuity's Tony Dwyer says stocks could fall 5 percent, and investors should buy the pullback. With CNBC's Melissa Lee and the Fast Money traders, Tim Seymour, Karen Finerman, Brian Kelly and Guy Adami.

title: Huawei licensing deals will be 'timely,' Trump reportedly says
text: US tech companies will be able to continue selling to Huawei.

title: Huawei Not Operating on the 'Up and Up': Rep. Gallego
text: Representative Ruben Gallego, an Arizona Democrat, discusses a meeting on Monday between tech executives and senior White House officials, security concerns with Huawei Technologies Co., and U.S. tensions with Iran. He speaks on "Bloomberg Technology".

title: Trump’s Fed board choice calls for rate reduction
text: President Trump’s nominee for the Federal Reserve Board, Judy Shelton, is calling on the Fed to lower interest rates by 50 basis points as soon as next week. “Even a 50-basis-point reduction would still keep the Fed funds rate well above zero,” Shelton told the Washington Post in an e-mail Monday.

title: Why Valley Forge Is 99% Invested in Stocks
text: Valley Forge Capital Management founder Dev Kantesaria discusses his firm's investment strategy on "Bloomberg Markets: The Close.

title: Swing Trading For Those Who Love Fundamentals
text: Swing trading conjures visions of buying at bottom and then selling at the top. That’s often just fanciful daydreaming, especially when one tries to confuse it for day-trading.

title: Why Gold's Relationship to the S&P 500 Is This Week's Hot Trade
text: In "Charting Futures: This Week,” Bloomberg Intelligence's Mike McGlone discusses the S&P 500's relationship with gold.

title: US Large Cap Indexes Close Higher to Start the Week on Monday
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at 27,171.90 Monday with a gain of 17.70 points or 0.07%.

title: What's next for emerging markets as America continues to outperform
text: Ruchir Sharma, chief global strategist and head of emerging markets at Morgan Stanley Investment Management, joins CNBC's "Closing Bell" to discuss what's next for emerging markets.

title: Stock Market Today: A Trio of Buys; Tech Ramps Ahead of Earnings
text: Tech stock were in focus as the Nasdaq led the way on the stock market today. Earnings will be a huge driver in the coming sessions, though.

title: Oil prices strengthen more than 1% on Iran risk
text: Oil prices rose more than 1% on Monday, as investors worried about possible supply disruptions in the energy-rich Middle East after Iran's seizure of a British tanker last week.

title: Tech leads U.S. stocks higher; oil gains
text: U.S. stocks gained ground on Monday at the onset of a heavy earnings week, while European shares inched higher as investors took heart from potential progress in U.S.-China trade talks and increasing geopolitical tensions sent oil prices climbing.

title: Dow Jones Today: Waiting on the Earnings Tidal Wave
text: Broadly speaking, stocks were somewhat listless Monday as traders await an absolute avalanche of marquee earnings reports this week.

title: A bit of 'retracement' and sell-off in next week: Barclay's Mike Lewis
text: Mike Lewis, managing director of U.S. equity cash trading at Barclays, joins CNBC's "Closing Bell" to discuss what's driven the day's market trading.

title: Huawei's U.S. research arm sends workers packing
text: Futurewei Technologies Inc, the U.S. research arm of China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd, began laying off workers on Monday, according to employees including one who spoke to Reuters as he left the company's Silicon Valley campus.

title: Stocks eke out small gains as investors prep for busy week of earnings
text: Stocks logged small gains Monday, buoyed by tech shares, as investors prepared for a busy week that will see more than 140 S&P 500 companies and a third of Dow Jones Industrial Average components deliver second-quarter results.

title: Why a Sub-3,000 S&P 500 Is Bullish for Gold
text: On this edition of "Charting Futures," Bloomberg Intelligence's Mike McGlone examines the outlook for the S&P 500 and his options strategy for gold futures with Bloomberg's Abigail Doolittle on "Bloomberg Markets: The Close.

title: Gold Heats Up and Silver Joins the Race
text: Now that gold has broken through the $1,450 an ounce level, a six-high year high, the next big test is $1,500. We may end up seeing those conditions emerge sooner rather than later.

title: Trump expected to attend White House tech meeting where Huawei will be discussed: sources
text: U.S. President Donald Trump is expected to drop in on a Monday meeting of top technology companies, including the chief executives of Intel Corp and Broadcom Inc, held to discuss blacklisted Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL] and other topics, two people briefed on the matter said.

title: Earnings recession still on track, but outlook has improved in the last week
text: With a out 16% of the S&P 500 SPX, +0.28% having reported earnings for he second-quarter, the aggregate blended estimate is a decline of 1.9% from a year ago, according to FactSet.

title: Howard Marks: How to Assess Risk in a Bull Market
text: Renowned value investor and Graham-Dodd disciple Howard Marks (Trades, Portfolio) freely shares his investment philosophy by way of his memos to clients of Oaktree Capital Management.

title: Oil not a leading indicator of stability in Middle East, says RBC's Croft
text: Helima Croft of RBC Capital Markets joins CNBC's "Power Lunch" team to break down what the escalating tensions between Iran and the U.S. means for oil markets.

title: Government delays decision on whether to restrict Huawei
text: Chinese tech firm’s equipment will continue to be used in UK’s 5G mobile networks for now.

title: Report: Huawei Helped Build North Korean Wireless Network
text: Chinese telecom giant Huawei Technologies Co. clandestinely helped North Korea build and maintain a commercial wireless network, The Washington Post reported Monday.

title: Why this investing pro says there is a 1-in-3 chance of recession in next 12 months
text: CNBC's "Power Lunch" team discusses markets with Peter Anderson, CIO of Andersen Capital, and Erik Ristuben of Russell Investments.

title: Here's how much FANG really matters to the market as tech giants prepare for earnings
text: Dave Nadig of ETF.com and John Davi of Astoria Advisors join CNBC's Bob Pisani to talk the best ETFs to invest in during earnings season.

title: Three Fixed Income Myths That Can Hold You Back From Investment Success
text: Are common misconceptions holding you back from owning bonds? Find out why most people need bonds, even if interest rates change, how bonds can add value, and what bonds can do for you, even if you don't need income.

title: Trading Eye For The Rate-Cut Guy
text: If monetary policy hawks were hoping to get a reprieve from the rising sentiment of an upcoming rate cut, Jerome Powell’s testimony in front of Congress earlier this month was probably not what they had in mind.

title: Here's why this economist thinks a rate cut might be pointless
text: Megan Greene, Financial Times columnist, joins "The Exchange" to discuss her op-ed on why a rate cut now would be pointless.

title: Trump: We will have to find out if Huawei worked with North Korea
text: President Trump made comments on Huawei ahead of his meeting with tech companies this afternoon.

title: Fed rate cut is likely, says Art Hogan
text: Dan Clifton, Strategas head of policy research, and Art Hogan, National Securities chief market strategist, discuss what the markets are watching in terms of the Fed's interest rate decision.

title: Nasdaq surges on big-tech strength, but most stocks decline
text: The Nasdaq Composite surged 0.7% in afternoon trading Monday, and was by far the best performer of the Big 3 stock market indexes, but internal market data would suggest otherwise.

title: Persian Gulf Tension Rises As Iran Claims Spy Ring Arrests, Britain Demands Ship Release
text: Investors on Monday continued to watch mounting tension in the Persian Gulf region as Iran said it arrested several Iranians working as American spies, Britain demanded that Iran’s government release a captured British tanker and its crew and U.S.

title: U.S. stocks led higher by tech on trade optimism; oil rises
text: U.S. stocks advanced on Monday at the onset of a heavy earnings week, while European shares inched higher as investors took heart from potential progress in U.S.-China trade talks and increasing geopolitical tensions sent oil prices higher.

title: Trump tweets about Fed but how will rate cuts impact the market?
text: Nuveen Strategist Brian Nicks discusses how rate cuts will impact the market with Adam Shapiro and Julie Hyman of Yahoo Finance.

title: Huawei's U.S. research arm laying off workers
text: The U.S.-based research arm of China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd - Futurewei Technologies Inc - announced worker layoffs on Monday, according to two Futurewei employees.

title: Prospective Trump Fed nominee Judy Shelton calls for a deeper rate cut later this month
text: "Even a 50-basis point reduction would still keep the Fed funds rate well above zero," Shelton told The Washington Post in an email.

title: Lawmakers introduce bill to turn President Trump's Huawei ban into law
text: CNBC's Ylan Mui reports from the White House as President Trump meets with tech executives and lawmakers introduce a bill to make the Huawei ban federal law.

title: Bridgepark's Stefan Selig discusses U.S. ban on Huawei
text: Stefan Selig of Bridgepark Adivsors joins "Squawk Alley" to discuss President Trump's meeting with tech execs and the ban on Huawei.

title: We are in an earnings recession, strategist says
text: Paul Gambles, co-founder of MBMG Group, discusses global markets amid intensifying geopolitical tensions and a slowing economy.

title: BlackRock Now Likes Europe As Savings Rates Get Destroyed
text: Thanks to the ECB, high yield now means no yield.

title: Canada Grows EU Trade In Shadow Of Trump's Protectionism
text: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau likely could not have had a better place to show European Union officials the benefits of a free trade agreement than the Port of Montreal.

title: Livongo Health IPO: What You Need To Know
text: A health care company that has shown strong top-line growth, benefiting from the escalating incidences of chronic illnesses is testing the IPO waters this week.

title: Amazon, Facebook, Boeing, Caterpillar and 3M are part of Zacks Earnings Preview
text: Amazon, Facebook, Boeing, Caterpillar and 3M are part of Zacks Earnings Preview
